bio:
Hey there! I'm Jason, a second year undergraduate at UC San Diego majoring in computer science and minoring in mathematics. My interests lie in the field of artificial intelligence, effective team management and computer science education.

As a part of the Early Research Scholars Program at UCSD, I'm currently involved in digital humanities research under Professor Taylor Berg-Kirkpatrick, working to develop fast line extraction algorithms for historical printed documents from the early modern period (1500-1800 AD). Additionally, during the summer of 2020, I will be interning at Microsoft as a part of their Explore Microsoft internship program.

I look to the future with optimism, and hope to one day become a leader in developing more capable artificial intelligence for the benefit of humanity.

projects.title: Digit Classifier
projects.description: A scalable Java neural network featuring the stochastic gradient descent algorithm to recognize digits in the MNIST data set.

projects.title: UCSD SSA Website
projects.description: The official website of the Symphonic Student Association at UC San Diego.
contribution: Developed a responsive layout of the home page navigation bar and background slideshow.
Utilized the PHP Google Calendar API to retrieve and display public calendar data.
Reverse engineered an embedded Google Calendar to modify its default appearance.

projects.title: fuzzy
projects.description: A virtual positive memory album developed to combat low self-esteem.

projects.title: OneByte
projects.description: A social media app to find and advertise free and low-cost local food. Submitted to SD Hacks 2018.
contribution: Implemented sending and retrieving data from a real-time database.
Developed the final layout and style of the entire app.

projects.title: FalconX Robotics Programming Curriculum
projects.description: An introduction to programming fundamentals for high school robotics students. Developed for the 2017-2018 FalconX Robotics programming sub-team.
